basics.name: Uche Mennel
basics.label: Software Craftsman
basics.summary: I am a software craftsman who enjoys working in a dynamic and interdisciplinary environment, always interested in new technologies and learning from others to improve my skills. I like to solve problems in the most consistent and elegant way. Just because it's fun. And because I believe that it pays of in the long run.

work.summary: As part of a team with about 10 members, I am responsible for:
highlights: Development of a distributed asynchronous data pipeline to leverage integration of heterogeneous/legacy software modules and scalability of computing resources. The data pipeline was mainly used for post-processing (i.e. visualization) of solver output (Python, C++, Boost, Twisted, gRPC, Protocol Bufers)
Python 3 migration and coordination with several teams across the globe
Maintenance of ACP (ANSYS Composite PrepPost) and its integration into ANSYS Workbench (Python, C#, C++, ZeroMQ)
Coordinating the development infrastructure for our team with several other development teams (Git, Linux, Artifactory, VSTS, TypeScript, TeamCity, Python, Docker)
Screening and interviewing of job candidates

work.summary: Worked on various IT-projects in the banking and government sector as developer and consultant
highlights: Development of a Windows 8 store app to administer enterprise cash equivalents (C#, XAML, MS-SQL, WCF, HTML5, JavaScript)
Elaboration of a detail concept and technical specifcation for a mobile cantonal tax application

work.summary: Implementation of CAE applications involving fnite element calculations, stochastic optimization, management and visualization of large datasets (C++, Python, SQL, C#, VTK, wxPython, HDF5)
Publication and documentation of code emerged from master thesis

volunteer.summary: We meet regularly to hear about new and old things within the Python ecosystem

courses: Master Thesis: A multilevel PCG algorithm for Î¼-FE analysis of bone structures

publications.name: ParFE - A fully-parallel FE code
publications.summary: Fully-parallel finite element solver to simulate linear elasticity of microstructural bone models

languages.fluency: Fluent (Worked for 5 years at Ansys, an American software company)
Fair (Intern for 3 months in Tunis, 3 months of civil service in Lausanne)
